intro: Hemicrambe townsendii, commonly known as Townsend's hemicrambe, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and slender, branching stems. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Hemicrambe townsendii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
